channel.title: Schnee | Software Security
channel.description: Recent content on Schnee | Software Security

item.title: Time-Locked Authentication Crackme Write-up
item.description: Reverse-engineering write-up of the Time-Locked Authentication crackme, focusing on buffer overflow.

item.title: Matryoshka Crackme Write-up
item.description: Reverse-engineering write-up of the Matryoshka crackme, focusing on its in-memory ELF loader using memfd_create and execve.

item.title: Finding Encrypted Game Values Using Cheat Engine
item.description: An introduction to locating decrypted runtime values in games using Cheat Engine, illustrated with MapleStory

item.title: About
item.description:
My name is Jakob Klocker, online known as Schnee. I started this blog in January 2026 to document software projects, CTF challenges and crackme write-ups.

Interests

  • Reverse engineering
  • Binary exploitation
  • Hypervisors & kernel internals
  • Anti-cheat and game security
  • Low-level systems & performance-oriented code

Writing

I aim to publish a new post roughly once per week, focusing on hands-on analysis and practical techniques.

  • GitHub: https://github.com/JakobKlocker
